//notes: the version with the charging handle and the BCG in the same package
if ever the weight of this upper is recalculated from constituent parts, these are likely the components for the upper

variants.description: A complete upper receiver assembly for AR-15-style firearms.  Includes a 16-inch barrel chambered in 5.56mm NATO, an unremarkable bolt carrier group, a BREACH changing handle, and a MOD 4 M-LOK handguard with a full top rail sitting flush with the upper receiver itself.  <variant:black>

A complete upper receiver assembly for AR-15-style firearms.  Includes a 16-inch barrel chambered in 5.56mm NATO, an unremarkable bolt carrier group, a BREACH changing handle, and a MOD 4 M-LOK handguard with a full top rail sitting flush with the upper receiver itself.  <variant:olive>

A complete upper receiver assembly for AR-15-style firearms.  Includes a 16-inch barrel chambered in 5.56mm NATO, an unremarkable bolt carrier group, a BREACH changing handle, and a MOD 4 M-LOK handguard with a full top rail sitting flush with the upper receiver itself.  <variant:brown>

notes: trim is only for the part where the barrel sticks ahead of the handguard
while not the most accurate, we model the upper as a cylinder based on the handguard's stated outer diameter, presuming that the uneven parts even out throughout the model

//integral_longest_side: on average, an AR-15 lower receiver has exactly 7 in. = 177.8 mm of space for an upper receiver
//add_mod: no slot for bayonet lug because the handguard leaves no space to attach a bayonet
only one slot for rail attachments because only the top rail exists on this handguard
two rail mount slots added here to model the handguard realistically
slot for underbarrel replaced with slot for underbarrel mount because there's no bottom rail on the handguard

variants.description: A complete upper receiver assembly for AR-15-style firearms.  Includes a 20-inch barrel chambered in 5.56mm NATO, standard-issue internal components, and a classic round handguard without any railing.  This model has been standard issue with the U.S. Army for years, and has now been stockpiled state-side for emergencies.  <variant:black>

A complete upper receiver assembly for AR-15-style firearms.  Includes a 20-inch barrel chambered in 5.56mm NATO, standard-issue internal components, and a classic round handguard without any railing.  This model has been standard issue with the U.S. Army for years, and has now been stockpiled state-side for emergencies.  <variant:black>

This receiver has clearly seen a fair amount of use, with scratches, blemishes, and dried stains of who knows what.  On the receiver, names have been scratched:
<name/scratched><name/scratched><name/scratched><name/scratched><name/scratched>

notes: we assume that any irregularities in volume even out over the cylinder volume of the receiver

//add_mod: we assume that the generic Picatinny rail mounts we have would be a good fit for the uncommon interface of the A2 handguard
//price: for the model with BCG and changing handle

variants.description: A complete upper receiver assembly for AR-15-style firearms.  Includes a 14.5-inch barrel chambered in 5.56mm NATO, standard-issue internal components, and a quad-rail handguard which stops just in front of the front sight post gas block.  This model has been standard issue with the U.S. Army for years, and has now been stockpiled state-side for emergencies.  <variant:black>

A complete upper receiver assembly for AR-15-style firearms.  Includes a 14.5-inch barrel chambered in 5.56mm NATO, standard-issue internal components, and a quad-rail handguard which stops just in front of the front sight post gas block.  This model has been standard issue with the U.S. Army for years, and has now been stockpiled state-side for emergencies.  <variant:black>

This receiver has clearly seen a fair amount of use, with scratches, blemishes, and dried stains of who knows what.  On the receiver, names have been scratched:
<name/scratched><name/scratched><name/scratched><name/scratched><name/scratched>

notes: trim is only for the part where the barrel sticks ahead of the handguard
while not the most accurate, we model the upper as a cylinder based on the handguard's stated outer diameter, presuming that the uneven parts even out throughout the model
